ygData.subject: RE: Semi-off topic question
ygData.msgSnippet: True, not only is it impossible to verify this but according to the EQ Guide document thing that snuck around for a while both apprentice guides and full
ygData.messageBody:
True, not only is it impossible to verify this but according to the EQ
Guide document thing that snuck around for a while both apprentice guides
and full guides are not allowed to create items for players, even in the
case of item loss. Senior guides are allowed to but it is usually for a GM
run quest.
So keep in mind that when a guide says they can't help it might not be that
they don't want to or know how to, it could be that their 'rank' doesn't
allow them to. You can always ask for it to be escalated to a higher guide
if you feel that it is important enough (and they are on, of course :)

Good Journey,

Sineras Silverlyre (Cazic-Thule)


8)-----Original Message-----
8)From: Blair, Keith (Keith Blair) [mailto:kblair@...]
8)Sent: Monday, October 18, 1999 8:25 AM
8)To: eqbards@onelist.com
8)Subject: RE: [eqbards] Semi-off topic question
8)
8)
8)From: "Blair, Keith (Keith Blair)" <kblair@...>
8)
8)> I was curious if anyone had had any luck getting quest
8)items that went
8)> into the Quest Black Hole (i.e. you gave the right items, but got
8)> nothing back) back. I'm asking because a friend had this
8)happen with
8)> his crafted gauntlets while trying to do the resize quest.
8)The Guide
8)> (I'm assuming it was a newer or lower level guide, not a
8)senior) told
8)> him that there was nothing that they could do, after making him wait
8)> for almost an hour (but that's another gripe) and that
8)there was no GM
8)> on anyway. Is there any chance he might get his gauntlets back?
8)
8)No chance. There's no way to verify that the quest was done
8)properly or done at all.
8)
